strength_details: IBM brand provides stability and global exposure
Focus on data engineering with BPM integration offers specialized experience
Opportunity to work with enterprise systems (ERP, CRM) and APIs
concern_details: Role title and description conflict (Application Developer vs Data Engineer)
Heavy focus on legacy BPM tools rather than modern data engineering stack
No clear career growth path or development opportunities mentioned
best_fit_details: Mid-level engineers with 3-7 years experience in BPM tools and enterprise systems
Candidates with Appian experience and database skills for enterprise environments
probe_details: Clarify whether this is primarily a data engineering or BPM development role
Ask about the technology stack beyond BPM tools and databases
Inquire about career progression opportunities within IBM Consulting
leverage_details: Appian experience is specifically required and may be rare
BPM and enterprise system integration experience is valuable for this role
summary.overall_assessment: Opportunity at established tech company IBM with focus on BPM and data engineering. Role has unclear boundaries between application development and data engineering, with emphasis on legacy tools. Best suited for mid-level engineers with BPM experience seeking enterprise environment. Limited modern data stack exposure and unclear growth path.
